title: "R Notebook"
output: html_notebook
---

Using Rcpp together with inline:

```{r}
src <- '
   double x = as<double>(x_);
   double ans=1.0, term=1.0, eps=1e-16;
   int n=0;
   while (fabs(term)>eps) {
    n++;
     term = term * x / n;
     ans = ans + term;
   }
   return(wrap(ans));'
```

Compiling, linking and loading is done with one function call:
```{r}
library(inline)
expfunC <- cxxfunction(signature(x_="numeric"), plugin="Rcpp", body=src)
```

```{r}
expfunC(5)
```

R data object (SEXPs) converted to C++ objects with as() C++ data object converted R data objects (SEXPs) with wrap(),
